extendedIngredients.name: dill pickle
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 CLAUSSEN Kosher Dill Pickle Half, finely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: water packed tuna
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (5 oz.) chunk light tuna in water, drained, flaked

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 21 dollars.

productMatches.title: Holm Oak Tasmania Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: This wine has beautiful lifted pear and jasmine characters on the nose with some hints of creamy, leesy characters underneath. Whilst the powerful palate is packed with flavor, it also has added complexity and weight as a result of the wild barrel ferment. The wine finishes with lovely crisp natural acidity.
